ObjectÔÉÅ

class larvaworld.lib.model.object.Object(model=None, id='Nada')[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Basic Class for all Larvaworld model objects.

This class extends the agentpy Object class by allowing the recording of nested attributes.

Parameters:

  • model (object, optional) ‚Äì The model this object belongs to.

  • id (str, optional) ‚Äì The unique identifier for this object.

idÔÉÅ

The unique identifier for this object.

Type:

str

typeÔÉÅ

The name of the object‚Äôs class.

Type:

str

logÔÉÅ

A dictionary for recording log data.

Type:

dict

modelÔÉÅ

The model this object belongs to.

Type:

object

pÔÉÅ

The parameters of the model.

Type:

object

__repr__()[source]ÔÉÅ

Return a string representation of the object.

__getattr__(key)ÔÉÅ

Raise an AttributeError for unknown attributes.

__getitem__(key)ÔÉÅ

Get an attribute value.

__setitem__(key, value)ÔÉÅ

Set an attribute value.

_set_var_ignore()ÔÉÅ

Store current attributes to separate them from custom variables.

vars()ÔÉÅ

Get a list of attribute names.

_log()ÔÉÅ

Access the log data.

extend_log(l, k, N, v)ÔÉÅ

Extend log data with a new value.

connect_log(ls)ÔÉÅ

Connect the log to the model‚Äôs dictionary of logs.

nest_record(reporter_dic)ÔÉÅ

Record nested attributes.

setup(**kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Initialize object attributes and actions.

Examples

The following setup initializes an object with three variables:

def setup(self, y):

self.x = 0 # Value defined locally self.y = y # Value defined in kwargs self.z = self.p.z # Value defined in parameters
